meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: State Oversight for Columbia Columbia University will pay $1.1 million to a fund to educate students about loans and will have its financial aid office monitored by state officials for five years, under a settlement with the attorney general in a student lending scandal.
PAGE B1
Qualms About Interrogations The Senate Intelligence Committee questioned the continuing value of the Central Intelligence Agency's secret interrogation program for terrorism suspects.
PAGE A18
Ex-Operative Sues C.I.A. Valerie Wilson sued the C.I.A. over its refusal to allow her to publish a memoir that would discuss how long she worked for the agency.
PAGE A18
Art of the Very Large Variety The sculptor Richard Serra, 67, ''one of the last great modernists in an age of minor talents,'' has a show at the Modern. A review by Michael Kimmelman.
WEEKEND, PAGE E25

Famous Genes Deciphered The full genome of James D. Watson, who with Francis Crick discovered the structure of DNA in 1953, has been deciphered, marking what some scientists believe is the gateway to an impending era of personalized genomic medicine.
PAGE A19

State Oversight for Columbia Columbia University will pay $1.1 million to a fund to educate students about loans and will have its financial aid office monitored by state officials for five years, under a settlement with the attorney general in a student lending scandal.
